meanings.definition: Choose or vote for (someone) to continue in office by casting a ballot in their favor.
meanings.sent1: The town reelects the mayor every four years.
meanings.sent2: The citizens will reelect their favorite candidate in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: It seems the town really likes the mayor since they always reelect him!
meanings.sent4: The idea of reelecting a leader shows trust and confidence in their abilities.
meanings.sent5: The act of reelecting ensures continuity in governance.

meanings.sent1: The school board reelects the principal for another term.
meanings.sent2: After his successful term, the people decided to reelect him as their representative.
meanings.sent3: I guess they couldn't find anyone better, so they had to reelect him!
meanings.sent4: Reelecting a leader can be a way to acknowledge their past achievements.
meanings.sent5: The community's decision to reelect the council member was met with applause.
